intro: Pristiglottis hasseltii, commonly known as the slender spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like clusters. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine in some regions. Pristiglottis hasseltii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic organisms.
